channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5711] Threading issue with Weld Switchyard and cxf-ws-policy
item.description:
Following stepps lead to weird state in fuse 6.3 build 107

JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:install switchyard-demo-security-propagation-jms
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:install cxf
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:list | grep cxf-ws-policy
 
[installed  ] [3.1.5.redhat-630107  ] cxf-ws-policy                                 cxf-3.1.5.redhat-630107                
JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:uninstall -v cxf-ws-policy
 
Uninstalling feature cxf-ws-policy 3.1.5.redhat-630107
 
Refreshing packages
 
# the console hangs here
item.summary: Threading issue with Weld Switchyard and cxf-ws-policy

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Is it possible that it's related to ENTESB-5217 - Feature Installation - no Refresh of Fragment-Host bundle upon installation of fragment bundle ?

Attaching output of jstack from features install testrun with 630 #115:
fuse_630107_deadlock_snapshot.jps

and fuse log fuse-630115-features_install.log

It looks like ENTESB-5217 has no effect on this issue.

I tried to build features-core with reverted fixes and and replace the bundle in jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-115/system/org/apache/karaf/features/org.apache.karaf.features.core/2.4.0.redhat-630115 and the issue is still there.

See 630115-deadlock.jps in jProfiler 8.1 -> Cpu views -> Call tree

  • thread sshd-SshServer[60bac790]-nio2-thread-1 -> Thread status: "Waiting"
  • thread FelixFrameworkWiring -> Thread status: "Blocked"

Grzegorz Grzybek, looks like deadlock is back in #131
jstack-630131-features-install-test.txt

Hmm, Josef Ludvicek. Tomohisa igarashi, Antonin Stefanutti, I have now weld deadlocks. I have 4 threads like this:

"weld-worker-1" #434 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fe190091800 nid=0x6ecb in Object.wait() [0x00007fe1830f0000]
 
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
 
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
 
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:502)
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.acquireGlobalLock(Felix.java:5179)
 
	- locked <0x00000000c050ddf0> (a [Ljava.lang.Object;)

all waiting for global lock while. FelixFrameworkWiring does this:

John Poth at least this commit is fine Because it affects (in good way) installation, not uninstallation.

I tried with:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:uninstall -v --no-auto-refresh cxf-ws-policy
 
Uninstalling feature cxf-ws-policy 3.1.5.redhat-630135
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> refresh
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root>

and it was fine.
But I checked the threads and again, I had deadlock:

and a bunch of:

"weld-worker-4" #641 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fac2a79c000 nid=0x7419 in Object.wait() [0x00007fac2535d000]
 
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)

	at org.ops4j.pax.cdi.weld.impl.bda.AbstractClassLoaderResourceLoader.classForName(AbstractClassLoaderResourceLoader.java:46)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.bootstrap.AnnotatedTypeLoader.loadClass(AnnotatedTypeLoader.java:65)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.bootstrap.AnnotatedTypeLoader.loadAnnotatedType(AnnotatedTypeLoader.java:60)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.bootstrap.BeanDeployer.addClass(BeanDeployer.java:97)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.bootstrap.ConcurrentBeanDeployer$1.doWork(ConcurrentBeanDeployer.java:65)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.bootstrap.ConcurrentBeanDeployer$1.doWork(ConcurrentBeanDeployer.java:62)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.executor.IterativeWorkerTaskFactory$1.call(IterativeWorkerTaskFactory.java:63)
 
	at org.jboss.weld.executor.IterativeWorkerTaskFactory$1.call(IterativeWorkerTaskFactory.java:56)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

Josef Ludvicek, Tomohisa igarashi, Tom Cunningham I have a fix that works: https://github.com/jboss-fuse/switchyard/compare/ENTESB-5711?expand=1
The problem with this particular scenario is that during refresh, some bundles are restarted, these bundles are picked up by org.ops4j.pax.cdi.extender.impl.CdiExtender, Weld container(s) is(are) created, bootstrapped and thread (FelixFrameworkWiring) awaits (holding global lock, because we're at package refresh).
At the same time, "weld-worker" threads load classes and if they can't be found, they're loaded dynamically - which is very very problematic with multithread scenarios.

My PR simply moves packages (that I found are needed) from DynamicImport-Package to Import-Package clause. And the deadlock is gone.

Can you review please?

I think I hit deadlock again in fuse 6.3 #145 - following two threads
switchyard-demo-security-propagation-jms was installed (136 out of 469)
and test stuck on features:install spring-test (337 out of 469)

EDIT excluding switchyard-demo-security-propagation-jms from test didn't help - it still freezes on blocked / waiting sshd-SshServer and FelixFrameworkWiring threads.

Verified:

  • Cannot reproduce anymore with fuse 6.3 build 159.
  • Dynamic import was removed from switchyard demo bundle.

There is a chance that can happen with another combination of bundles,
because the issue with dynamic imports in osgi framework is still unresolved (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FELIX-4308).

Closing issue.
